intro: Euphrasia latifolia f. lapponum, commonly known as the Lapland eyebright, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, with the foliage often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, with prominent dark veins, and are pollinated by insects.
